Case Study

Outlook Add-in - Feedback app

Project Overview

This project was assigned to me as a Hands-on Assignment while I was interviewing with a company for a UX Designer role. The requirement was to two different flows for a Feedback collection app, as an outlook add-in and a SPA (Single page appliaiton). Both of these applicaiton have have different requirements.

I was asked to complete the design assignment within 2-4 days and consolidate all the design activities & deliverables within a single PDF file and try to articulate the entire design process being followed along with assumptions made, if any. The company were expecting the key design activities including my UX analysis, task flows, conceptual sketches, detailed wireframes and visual mockups (optional).

My role

UX/UI Designer

Methods and Tools

Competitive Analysis, IA, Visual Design, Adobe XD

Practices

Design System, Product Thinking, Interaction design, Visual Design, User research, UX & UI Design, Prototyping

  • Feedback widget
  • Feedback responsive web app

Project Context

Designing a responsive widget or pluggable component to provide quick feedback. This widget needs to have a fluid minimalistic design, so that it can be configured as “plug-in” for any existing office web app like Outlook, Word, Excel or PPT. The design needs to be scalable, intuitive as well as efficient to enable users to provide quick feedback within short span of time i.e. minimum number of clicks.

The following are key business requirements:

  • The feedback needs to be provided in 2 steps – ?providing the rating and then specifying the feedback category or categories where the selected rating will apply.
  • The rating will have 5 options to choose from and it could be anything like excellent, very good, good, fair, poor, etc. Or, it could be some other related content.
  • The feedback category will have 10 options to choose from and user can choose multiple options.
  • The feedback category names could be the list of competencies like meticulous, confidence, diligence, attention to details, discipline, communication skills, etc. Or, it could be some other related content.
  • The widget should apply the same rating to all the selected categories.
  • The widget should allow user to capture the free text comments as part of the overall feedback submission.
  • The widget should automatically recognize & show the user for whom the feedback is to be provided based upon the user-context from office apps. It would be an email sender in case of Outlook and the document owner in case of Word, Excel or PPT apps.
  • The widget should let user submit or cancel the feedback.
  • The widget should acknowledge the user on successful submission of the feedback.
  • The widget should allow the user to submit the feedback over and again for same or another employee.

Process

Discover, Define, Design and Deliver
I followed HCD process by first conducting user research. After synthesizing inspiring insights from survey and interviews, I defined the problem and jumped right into the ideation phase. From sketches all the way into fidelity prototypes, I gradually created the first version of the application. I also conducted in-house usability testings and iterated more based on the feedback I received.

Ideation

Understanding the Product
I conducted the competetive analysis to study how other products takle the similar problems. I picked 6 competive products to compare the overall UI and flows and 5 well established design system to learn how to effectively deliver the product.

Information Architecture

Paper sketches

Wireframe

Visual Design

Project Context

Design a responsive web page to provide a detailed feedback for a specific employee. This web page design will be for a separate single page application (SPA) and is not directly related to pluggable feedback widget designed above. The design needs to be responsive, scalable, as well as intuitive to enable users to provide detailed feedback for a specific employee. The design should support multiple from factors and should provide optimal experience for desktop, tablet & mobile layouts.

The following are key business requirements:

  • The feedback needs to be provided in 2 steps – ?selecting the employee and then providing a specific rating against one or more feedback categories.
  • The page should allow the user to lookup & select a specific employee, and provide a separate feedback rating against one or more feedback categories, unlike in the case of widget.
  • The rating can have the same 5 options to choose from that were used for the feedback widget above.
  • The feedback category can have the same 10 options to choose from that were used for widget above.
  • The user should be able to view the additional details for a specific feedback category like description of the category, rating guidelines for providing feedback, etc.
  • The page should allow the user to capture separate rating as well as comments for each feedback category.
  • The page should allow user to capture additional comments as part of the overall feedback submission.
  • The page should let user submit or cancel the feedback.
  • The page should acknowledge the user on successful submission of the feedback.
  • The page should not allow the user to resubmit the feedback for the same employee but should allow the user to modify or change the feedback after submission.

Process

Discover, Define, Design and Deliver
I followed HCD process by first conducting user research. After synthesizing inspiring insights from survey and interviews, I defined the problem and jumped right into the ideation phase. From sketches all the way into fidelity prototypes, I gradually created the first version of the application. I also conducted in-house usability testings and iterated more based on the feedback I received.

Ideation

Understanding the Product
I conducted the competetive analysis to study how other products takle the similar problems. I picked 6 competive products to compare the overall UI and flows and 5 well established design system to learn how to effectively deliver the product.
